Description: Sets the name of the server as shown on the public server list. [Unity Rich Text](https://docs.unity3d.com/Packages/com.unity.ugui@1.0/manual/StyledText.html) formatting is allowed. The server must be [verified](https://scpsl.notion.site/How-do-I-verify-my-server-A-step-by-step-guide-34235d219dce43c7bf47b7c158fa069d) to appear on the list
Sets the server title (name) displayed only in the player list. Specify "default" to use the Server Name
Sets the time interval between refreshes of the server title in the player list. Specify "default" instead of a number to use the default set by the server

Sets the pastebin ID used for the info tab on the server browser. The ID can be found in your browser's web address bar when creating a new file on pastebin. Required for the server to be included on the public server list
Sets the contact email address of the server owner or adminstrator, as used to verify the server. Required for the server to be included on the public server list
If set, the server will be hidden from the public server list, even if otherwise verified and accessible
If set, enables the server to connect to the central servers. Otherwise, UserID based bans, reserved slots, the whitelist, and remote admin authentication will also be disabled

If set, the public server list will show the server as using a whitelist. ONLY enable this if the server is verified and uses a plugin or modification that provides a custom whitelist. See the [Verified Server Rules](https://scpslgame.com/Verified_server_rules.pdf) for details

If set, the public server list will show the server as having access restrictions. ONLY enable this if the server is verified and uses a plugin or modification that restricts access other than by whitelist (such as password). See the [Verified Server Rules](https://scpslgame.com/Verified_server_rules.pdf) for details
Sets the maximum number of players that may connect to the server at one time. Cannot generally exceed 60 for a server to be included on the public server list
If set, only whitelisted players will be able to join, as specified in config/UserIDWhitelist.txt
If set, IP banning will be enabled. Disable this if the server is behind a proxy, firewall, or anti-DDoS system that changes IP addresses from players to own
Sets the server tickrate (fps)
Sets the waiting time before the game starts. Specify "default" instead of a number to use the default set by the server
If set, reserved slots will be enabled
Enables the server's query protocol
If set, the query protocol will be enabled over IPv6
Sets the administrator password for the query protocol
Forces a single map seed for all rounds. -1 = random
If required, you can change the IPv4 binding of the server by changing the 'Server IP Address' setting under Security and Privacy
Sets the IPv6 binding of the server. Default is :: (all IPs). Change to a specific IPv6 address on the host if really needed

Server plugins using the Northwood Plugin API must be downloaded to the 'AppData/SCP Secret Laboratory/PluginAPI/plugins/<GamePort>' directory in the instance datastore. Plugins using the EXILED plugin framework must be downloaded to the 'AppData/EXILED/Plugins' directory, and EXILED must be installed using the "Install EXILED" setting under SteamCMD and Updates. More [information on plugins](https://scpsl.notion.site/How-do-I-install-plugins-on-my-server-e7a64ab5b0e541a59333ffbaab2f52c5)
If set, the server will kick a player after they exceed the command rate limits. Otherwise, command execution will just be disabled
If set, prevents players with the same account from joining the server simultaneously
If set, anticheat-related messages will be displayed in the server console
If enabled, logs related to pre-authentication will be displayed in the server console
Sets the time period before a new rejection is logged (when using the Query Response System)
Sets the time period before a new challenge issuance is logged
If enabled, the server will automatically create port mappings on UPnP enabled routers
Specifies additional LocalAdmin (not server binary) startup parameters that are not otherwise set by AMP. Use with care (don't set any path arguments)
Specifies additional server binary (not LocalAdmin) startup parameters that are not otherwise set by AMP. Use with care (don't set any path arguments)
Sets the forced class on round start. -1 = random
Sets the default range that the player information text appears on clients

Sets the percentage of stamina used per second while sprinting. Express as a decimal, eg: 0.05 = 5%, 0.33 = 33%. Stamina is currently only utilised on humans. 0 = disabled, but this will cause weirdness with status effects and other mechanics
Sets the period during which newly-spawned players can sprint without consuming stamina. Used to reduce visual artifacts. Recommended minimum = 2
Sets the period that must pass before stamina starts regenerating after the player stops sprinting. Lower values are more likely to be exploited by players. Higher higher can be annoying to players
Sets how fast the stamina regenerates. This is a multiplier for the default setting, which is based on a curve - not a specific value
Sets how long a player can be AFK in their spawn location before being kicked by the server. 0 = disabled
If set, the server will constantly check AFK status
Sets the message shown to a player when kicked for AFK
Sets the intercom cooldown period after use
Sets the maximum period that a player can use the intercom at one time
Sets the time period after a round has ended for the round to restart
If set, enables faster round restart after a round has ended
Sets the length of time after a round has ended for the round to restart
If set, friendly fire for humans will be enabled
Sets the friendly fire multiplier
Sets the countdown timer until the warhead detonates
If enabled, the entrance gates will be forced open when the warhead is counting down
DisplayName: Force Gates Open During Detonation Timer

Description: If enabled, all checkpoints will be locked when the warhead is counting down, thereby isolating zones
If enabled, all normal doors and checkpoints will be foced open when the warhead is counting down
DisplayName: Force Doors/Checkpoints Open During Detonation Timer

Description: If enabled, when a player escapes they will keep old items, rather than the items falling on the ground
If set, players will be able to play as the tutorial class
If set, disables the decontamination process in the facility
If enabled, locked doors can be destroyed by SCP-096
DisplayName: Allow SCP-096 To Destroy Locked Doors

Description: If set, disables the holidays and other generation events (like Halloween)
If set, handcuffed players will be able to interact with doors or elevators
Sets how SCP-914 operates on players
Sets how much the sinkhole makes a player slower
Sets the chance of spawning a sinkhole. 0 = disabled
If enabled, disconnecting players will drop their items
If enabled, a round ends when there is only one player left
If enabled, handcuffed escapees will change teams
Sets the number of exits in the pocket dimension
If set, enables broadcasts for player kicks

DefaultValue: %nick% has been kicked from this server.
Description: Sets the text that is displayed when a player gets kicked
Sets the broadcast kick message duration
If set, enables broadcasts for player bans

DefaultValue: %nick% has been banned from this server.
Description: Sets the text that is displayed when a player gets banned
Sets the broadcast ban message duration
If set, enables spawn protection for newly spawned players
Sets the duration of spawn protection for newly spawned players. Specify "default" instead of a number to use the default set by the server
If set, allows spawn protected players to shoot
Sets spawn protection for the selected team(s). Specify the teams in a comma-separated list in square brackets
Sets the minimum time it can take from the last wave for a new one to spawn
Sets the maximum time it can take from the last wave for a new one to spawn
Sets the number of players who can respawn as MTF
Sets the number of players who can respawn as Chaos Insurgents
If set, MTF will be a top priority for a respawn team
If set, enables better generation randomness by using a cryptographic random number generator (RNG). Note: Uses more CPU to generate numbers
Sets the pattern in which the classes spawn at round start. Specify "default" instead of a number to use the default set by the server

If set, enables the respawn tickets system. Each MTF or CI player spawned in consumes one ticket. Recommended for game balance. Even if disabled, the MTF:CI ticket ratio will still determine their spawn chance
Sets the starting count for MTF respawn tickets. The ratio of MTF:CI tickets directly determines which team has a higher chance of spawning
Sets the starting count for Chaos Insurgents respawn tickets. The ratio of MTF:CI tickets directly determines which team has a higher chance of spawning
Sets the number of tickets MTF get for letting a Disarmed Class D escape. Specify "default" instead of a number to use the default set by the server
DisplayName: MTF Respawn Tickets Class D Cuffed Escape Count

Description: Sets the number of tickets MTF get for letting a Scientist escape. Specify "default" instead of a number to use the default set by the server
DisplayName: MTF Respawn Tickets Scientist Escape Count

Description: Sets the number of tickets MTF get for damaging an SCP. Specify "default" instead of a number to use the default set by the server
DisplayName: MTF Respawn Tickets SCP Damage Escape Count

Description: Sets the number of tickets CI get for letting a Class D escape. Specify "default" instead of a number to use the default set by the server
DisplayName: CI Respawn Tickets Class D Escape Count

Description: Sets the number of tickets CI get for letting a Disarmed Scientist escape. Specify "default" instead of a number to use the default set by the server
DisplayName: CI Respawn Tickets Scientist Cuffed Escape Count

Description: Sets the number of tickets CI get for killing a Scientist. Specify "default" instead of a number to use the default set by the server
DisplayName: CI Respawn Tickets Scientist Killing Count

Description: Sets the number of tickets CI get when a Class D or Chaos Insurgent uses an SCP item. Specify "default" instead of a number to use the default set by the server
DisplayName: CI Respawn Tickets SCP Item Count

Description: Sets the server branch to install. Update the server after switching branches

If enabled, the [EXILED plugin framework](https://github.com/Exiled-Official/EXILED/) will be installed when the server is updated. If disabled, any installed EXILED files will be removed when the server is updated
